parameters.name: UserGroupId
parameters.description: User-defined ID of a command group

parameters.name: Count
parameters.description: Number of command IDs in the given command group

parameters.name: UserIDs
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of integer IDs VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

title: ICommandManager.IGetGroupDataFromRegistry
description: Gets the command IDs of the given command group from the registry.
signature:
System.Boolean IGetGroupDataFromRegistry( 
   System.Int32
UserGroupId
,
   System.Int32
Count
,
   out System.Int32
UserIDs
)

parameters.name: UserGroupId
parameters.description: User-defined ID of a command group

parameters.name: Count
parameters.description: Number of command IDs in the given command group

parameters.name: UserIDs
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of integer IDs VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

returns: True if successful, false if not
remarks:
Before calling this method call
ICommandManager::GetCommandIDsCount
to populate Count.
Use this method to compare command group IDs obtained through the user interface with those stored in the registry.
